title: Momentum and Impulse

Momentum and Impulse

ðŸ”¥ The Spark

Why does a cricket ball hurt more when caught at high speed than when it barely reaches the fielder? The answer lies in momentum â€” the quantity of motion an object carries!

ðŸ’¡ The Simple Core

Momentum (p) = mass Ã— velocity (p = mv). SI unit: kgÂ·m/s. The greater the mass or velocity, the greater the momentum. Impulse = Force Ã— Time = Change in momentum (J = FÎ”t = Î”p). Law of Conservation of Momentum: In a closed system with no external forces, total momentum before = total momentum after a collision.

ðŸŽ¯ The Show

A cricket batsman follows through after hitting the ball â€” this increases contact time, which reduces the average force (impulse = same, but spread over longer time). Crumple zones in cars work the same way. Two billiard balls colliding: total momentum before = total momentum after. Even India's Chandrayaan missions use momentum conservation for orbital manoeuvres!
